title: SinoTrack GPS Devices Vulnerable to Remote Vehicle Control via Default Passwords
summary:
Two security vulnerabilities have been disclosed in SinoTrack GPS devices that could be exploited to control certain remote functions on connected vehicles and even track their locations.
"Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to access device profiles without auth

title: How to Build a Lean Security Model: 5 Lessons from River Island
summary: In today’s security landscape, budgets are tight, attack surfaces are sprawling, and new threats emerge daily. title: Microsoft Patches 67 Vulnerabilities Including WEBDAV Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild
summary:
Microsoft has released patches to fix 67 security flaws, including one zero-day bug in Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) that it said has come under active exploitation in the wild.
Of the 67 vulnerabilities, 11 are rated Critical and 56 are rated Important in severity. This includes

title: Patch Tuesday, June 2025 Edition
summary: Microsoft today released security updates to fix at least 67 vulnerabilities in its Windows operating systems and software.
